gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.Cursor
Class XOR_PanCursor

java.lang.Object
  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.Cursor.XOR_PanCursor
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
BoxPanCursor
public abstract class XOR_PanCursor
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

This class is an abstract base class for cursors that translate but do not change size.

See Also:
BoxPanCursor, Serialized Form

Method Detail

draw

public abstract void draw(java.awt.Graphics graphics,
                          java.awt.Point p1,
                          java.awt.Point p2)
Abstract method to draw the cursor shape, determined by two points, the starting point and a second designated point. Since XOR drawing is used, this method will be called twice for each cursor move. The first call will be made to erase the previous cursor by drawing it again. The second call will be made to draw a new cursor position. Derived classes should implement this to actually draw the desired cursor shape.

Parameters:
graphics - The graphics context that the shape should be drawn in.
p1 - The starting point for this cursor action, such as the first corner of a box cursor.
p2 - The second point for this cursor action, such as the other corner of a box cursor.

init

public boolean init(java.awt.Point p1,
                    java.awt.Point p2)
Initialize the bounds of the box. This must be done any time the size of the box changes.

Parameters:
p1 - first defining point of the region.
p2 - second defining point of the region.

translate

public boolean translate(java.awt.Point p)
Move the first defining point of the cursor to the new point. All other points are translated the same distance.

Parameters:
p - The new defining point the cursor is being translated to.

moveEdge

public boolean moveEdge(int edge,
                        int amount)
